content: mountain pass cowl crochet pattern by tara briggs @taralovescrochet mountain pass cowl - march 2021 1 basic information pattern is written in us crochet terms yarn dk weight about 350 yards i used lang yarns gordon in three colors i highly recommend a natural fiber that will relax when blocked if using fibers with less drape go up a hook size for more laciness and drape hook us size j 6mm fit one size fits most size is adjustable by adding or subtracting starting chains/ foundation stitches in groups of 4 finished size 15 tall 28-29 circumference - after blocking gauge 14 stitches by 9 row in pattern - after blocking pattern is written for 3 colors if using only one color disregard color changes all other notes and stitches will still apply abbreviations and symbols chain - chain skip - skip st - stitch slip_stitch - slip_stitch double_crochet - double_crochet fhdc - foundation half_double_crochet optional * * - repeat this section - stitch counts for that round mountain pass cowl - march 2021 2 notes - cowl is worked in joined unturned rounds do not turn at the end of the round - when working the crossed stitches always work in front of the sts just made - stitch counts are given at the end of each round in - chain 2 at the beginning of a round does not count as a stitch - keep your double crochets loose when working the crossed stitches if you notice your row are not laying flat go up a hook size - pay careful attention to where each round joins some row join into the turning chains some join into the 1st stitch these are important to keep the pattern aligned as the row stack up - when skipping stitches do not count the join stitch as a stitch skip the next two unworked stitches see photo -> - at the end of each crossed stitch round rounds 2 13 24 and repeats the third from last double_crochet will be worked into the join stitch from the previous round < - see photo mountain pass cowl - march 2021 3 customization options - for a looser or tighter fit add or subtract foundation stitches in sets of 4 the pattern needs a multiple of 4 stitches to work out evenly - for a taller or shorter cowl omit or add repeats in the middle row - for a solid color cowl omit the color changes as well as row 12 and 23 this may make your cowl slightly shorter but you can add a repeat to counteract this - to change colors cleanly in a place other than the places described work one single_crochet row in your first color change colors and work a second single_crochet row in the new color this gives a very clean transition pattern with color a round 1 fhdc 100 slip_stitch into 1st fhdc to join into a circle be careful not to twist the loop
